Watching ESL stream reruns of old pro games.

You're thinking of the Metagolem:

Triforce / Atma's Impaler / Warmog's Armor / Frozen Mallet

* Triforce procs were the main source of damage, but also offered a little Attack Speed and some Critical Strike Chance to get decent DPS
* Atma's Impaler gave Bonus AD based on Max Health while also having some Armor and Critical Strike Chance
* Warmog's Armor gave huge flat Health (1380 when fully stacked I think) and solid Health Regen...which then meant more AD from Atma's
* Frozen Mallet gave a nice slow on all basic attacks to keep people in your death zone while giving a huge amount of flat Health...which meant even more AD from Atma's

So you have tons of Health, some Armor, and tons of damage from Triforce procs and solid AD (plus the occasional Crit), on top of having a perma-slow and having room in your build for Merc Treads and Force of Nature to completely invalidate Mages and Supports. At full build, anyone like Garen that had inherent tankiness became unkillable even in a 1v5.

But Riven didn't use Metagolem. She went full glass cannon stacking nothing but Bloodthirsters and exploded people.

Except I am not thinking of the Metagolem.
And Riven did not go glass cannon.


That being said, I got my seasons wrong, and I am thinking more of Season 3 than Season 2.

Not back when nearly every AD assassin/fighter rushed Brutalizer + Last Whisper it wasn't. It was pretty rare to see anyone build tanky back then, even immobile melees. Assassins (and mobile fighters like Lee/Riven) were probably at their best during that time period, and it was a dark time for tanks. Only tanks with %damage reduction in their kits could function reliably, but they still went down pretty quick. 

Naturally, the response to this would be to just rush HP. Well Riot thought of that, which is why Botrk was insanely strong back then and the active had burst (it used to be Zed's precious). Even Quinn used to rush Ghostblade + Botrk, and it didn't matter what you built after that because you could kill anyone.
That sounds horrible.

It was, especially on Dominion, where (past a certain point) the meta was just to rush penetration and CDR. 

Every single AD champion went Brutalizer + Last Whisper (Boots of Lucidity or Mercs)

Every single AP (including tanks) went Haunting Guise + Void Staff/Blackfire Torch (Boots of Lucidity or Sorcerers boots)

ADCs were in a similar situation as now, but flat penetration was less situational, so they had at least some early-mid presence, but they still died to everyone and everything. Personally, I think it's nice to see tanks perform well for a change. Lethality just needs to be tweaked so it can actually damage bruisers, then I think assassins will have room to improve.

3K health for Bruisers has been the norm for a while unless you are a few notable ones that buy more or less, like Dr. Mundo and Volibear. Lane bullies back would rush Brutalizer, but those were the only big ones.
